intro: Paspalum conjugatum f. tristachyum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf paspalum, is a grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically less than 2 mm wide. The inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each branch, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and riparian areas. This grass is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in aquatic environments.
